title: 1.8 per cent measurement of $H_0$ from Cepheids alone
summary: This paper presents a 1.8% measurement of $H_0$ using Cepheid periods and magnitudes, anchor distances, and host galaxy redshifts from SH0ES data. It introduces improvements in selection modeling and error propagation.
usefulness_reason: The paper explicitly uses "SH0ES data" and discusses "Cepheid periods and magnitudes" and "host galaxy redshifts," which are forms of survey data. While not directly about spatio-temporal *point processes*, it deals with spatio-temporal *measurements* from a survey.
